message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SY, cs.DC

The paper proposes a data-driven decision framework using a Deep LSTM Network to predict the Remaining Useful Life (RUL) of components in a system, specifically hard disks in backend data servers. This involves extensive data pre-processing, feature extraction, and validation through online simulation sets. The paper also discusses the architecture of the neural network and the mechanisms to choose various hyper-parameters. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as the paper deals with developing a data-driven decision framework using deep learning techniques. Additionally, cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) are also likely as the paper deals with improving the reliability of components in a system.
